newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SOCCER-PORTO SAIL TO EASY SWEDISH VICTORY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-PORTO SAIL TO EASY SWEDISH VICTORY.

text.p: Porto, already assured a European Cup quarter-final place, refused to rest on their laurels on Wednesday and outplayed a jaded-looking Gothenburg 2-0 to underline their supremacy in Group D of the Champions' League.

Mario Jardel netted his fourth goal of the Champions' League series with a powerful header from a pinpoint cross from substitute Artur, a fellow Brazilian, giving international goalkeeper Thomas Ravelli no chance.

Artur, who replaced Fernando Mendes at halftime, played a perfect through-ball to midfielder Edmilson Pimenta one minute before the final whistle and his compatriot slotted the ball home to make it 2-0.
Gothenburg, who went into the game with no chance of qualifying, gave a lacklustre performance in a half-full Ullevi stadium.
Porto remained unbeaten in the group, with five wins in their six Champions' League matches, and now meet England's Manchester United in the quarter-finals.
